text: Reggie Hannah (August 4, 1959 – October 23, 2015) was an American basketball player. A native of Titusville, Florida, Hannah led Titusville High to a pair of state title appearances in the mid-1970s. He played college basketball for Florida and South Alabama before being selected by the Cleveland Cavaliers in the fourth round (70th overall pick) of 1982 NBA draft. He never played in the NBA, but did play in Sweden, France, and the Netherlands. Hannah struggled with drug addiction. According to Florida Today, Hannah died on October 23, 2015 of pancreatic cancer. ==References== Category:1959 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American expatriate basketball people in France Category:American expatriate basketball people in Sweden Category:American expatriate basketball people in the Netherlands Category:Basketball players from Florida Category:Cleveland Cavaliers draft picks Category:Florida Gators men's basketball players Category:Parade High School All-Americans (boys' basketball) Category:People from Titusville, Florida Category:Power forwards (basketball) Category:South Alabama Jaguars men's basketball players Category:Wyoming Wildcatters players Category:American men's basketball players
title: Reggie Hannah
